issue.title: Convert ./components/widgets/menu/menu_group.tsx from Class Component to Function Component

labels.name: Difficulty/1:Easy
labels.description: Easy ticket

labels.name: Good First Issue
labels.description: Suitable for first-time contributors

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Community help wanted

issue.body:
We want to move most of our codebase from Class Components to Function Components. This decision is based on [React recommendations](https://react.dev/reference/react/Component).

The task is to update the component to be a functional component, without any difference in functionality. Also, all related tests that fail may need refactoring.

Here are a few examples of the required changes:
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24187
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24210
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24183
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24181

If the tests do not work because they rely on the behavior of Class Components they also have to be migrated to functionaly test the same behavior. We prefer the use of `react-testing-library` for new tests, but it is not required.

When submitting the PR, please make sure to identify where and when the component shows, for QA to properly test the changes.


----

If you're interested please comment here and come [join our "Contributors" community channel](https://community.mattermost.com/core/channels/tickets) on our daily build server, where you can discuss questions with community members and the Mattermost core team. For technical advice or questions, please  [join our "Developers" community channel](https://community.mattermost.com/core/channels/developers).

New contributors please see our [Developer's Guide](https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/).

JIRA LINK: MM-54814

issue.title: MM-54814: Convert ./components/widgets/menu/menu_group.tsx from Class Component to Function Component

3. Take a look at other repository specific documentation at https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute
-->

A description of what this pull request does, as well as QA test steps (if applicable and if not already added to the Jira ticket).
-->
Convert ./components/widgets/menu/menu_group.tsx from Class Component to Function Component

#### Ticket Link
<!--
If applicable, please include both or either of the following links:
-->

Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/24775
Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54814

#### Screenshots
<!--
If the PR includes UI changes, include screenshots/GIFs.

For an easier comparison of UI changes a table (template below) can be used.

|  before  |  after  |
|----|----|
| <insert before screenshot here> | <insert after screenshot here> |

-->

#### Release Note

Add a release note for each of the following conditions:

* Config changes (additions, deletions, updates).
* API additions—new endpoint, new response fields, or newly accepted request parameters.
* Database changes (any).
* Schema migration changes. Use the [Schema Migration Template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18lD7N32oyMtYjFrJKwsNv8yn6Fe5QtF-eMm8nn0O8tk/edit?usp=sharing) as a starting point to capture these details as release notes. 
* Websocket additions or changes.
* Anything noteworthy to a Mattermost instance administrator (err on the side of over-communicating).
* New features and improvements, including behavioral changes, UI changes, and CLI changes.
* Bug fixes and fixes of previous known issues.
* Deprecation warnings, breaking changes, or compatibility notes.

If no release notes are required, write NONE. Use past-tense. Newlines are stripped.

Examples:

```
Added new API endpoints POST /api/v4/foo, GET api/v4/foo, and GET api/v4/foo/:foo_id.
```

```
Added a new config setting ServiceSettings.FooBar. Added a new column Foo to the Users table.
```

```
NONE
```
-->
```release-note
NONE
```

issue.title: Admin console definition to typescript

labels.name: Docs/Not Needed
labels.description: Does not require documentation

labels.name: 3: QA Review
labels.description: Requires review by a QA tester

labels.name: release-note-none
labels.description: Denotes a PR that doesn't merit a release note.

issue.body:
#### Summary
As part of the effort of migrating to Typescript, this was one of the stoppers
because migrating such a big file can be painful. I wrote the original version,
so I had good understanding of the reasons behind the current implementation,
so I was in good position to migrate it.

I migrated it with very small change in the approach about subsections, using a
specific field for that (making the typing better).

Reopened from #24658 to get through QA (was accidentally merged without QA and we reverted it)

#### Ticket Link
[MM-54855](https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54855)

#### Release Note
```release-note
NONE
```

[MM-54855]: https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54855?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

comment.body: @lindy65 was a new one... merging it with main.

issue.title: MM-55113: Replace usage of LocalizedIcon in 'user_settings_security.tsx' with i/span tags

labels.name: Setup Cloud Test Server
labels.description: Setup an on-prem test server

labels.name: release-note-none
labels.description: Denotes a PR that doesn't merit a release note.

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for contributing a pull request! Here are a few tips to help you:

1. If this is your first contribution, make sure you've read the Contribution Checklist https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/contribution-checklist/
2. Read our blog post about "Submitting Great PRs" https://developers.mattermost.com/blog/2019-01-24-submitting-great-prs
3. Take a look at other repository specific documentation at https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute
-->

#### Summary
<!--
A description of what this pull request does, as well as QA test steps (if applicable and if not already added to the Jira ticket).
-->
Replace usage of LocalizedIcon in 'user_settings_security.tsx' with i/span tags

I've followed instructions but the component is already using Utils.formatMessage in other places. I was wondering if those could also be converted or if it would be wise to also use Utils.formatMessage for icons

#### Ticket Link
<!--
If applicable, please include both or either of the following links:
-->

Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/25097
Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-55113

#### Screenshots
<!--
If the PR includes UI changes, include screenshots/GIFs.

For an easier comparison of UI changes a table (template below) can be used.
-->
|  before  |  after  |
|----|----|
| ![image](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/assets/60970/1b6d761d-449f-4ca6-a952-8ef8e7e5ddfa) | ![image](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/assets/60970/bcd39cb9-3b1a-4d9e-9f6f-e88d5ced55bc) |



#### Release Note
<!--
Add a release note for each of the following conditions:

* Config changes (additions, deletions, updates).
* API additions—new endpoint, new response fields, or newly accepted request parameters.
* Database changes (any).
* Schema migration changes. Use the [Schema Migration Template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18lD7N32oyMtYjFrJKwsNv8yn6Fe5QtF-eMm8nn0O8tk/edit?usp=sharing) as a starting point to capture these details as release notes. 
* Websocket additions or changes.
* Anything noteworthy to a Mattermost instance administrator (err on the side of over-communicating).
* New features and improvements, including behavioral changes, UI changes, and CLI changes.
* Bug fixes and fixes of previous known issues.
* Deprecation warnings, breaking changes, or compatibility notes.

If no release notes are required, write NONE. Use past-tense. Newlines are stripped.

Examples:

```
Added new API endpoints POST /api/v4/foo, GET api/v4/foo, and GET api/v4/foo/:foo_id.
```

```
Added a new config setting ServiceSettings.FooBar. Added a new column Foo to the Users table.
```

```
NONE
```
-->
```release-note
NONE
```

comment.body: Test server creation failed. See the logs for more information.

I'm used to auto formatting with prettier which is difficult to enable on your project due to too much noisy changes, sorry to have missed that.

I'll check the pipeline error thanks

issue.title: Convert ./components/widgets/menu/menu_group.tsx from Class Component to Function Component

labels.name: Difficulty/1:Easy
labels.description: Easy ticket

labels.name: Good First Issue
labels.description: Suitable for first-time contributors

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Community help wanted

issue.body:
We want to move most of our codebase from Class Components to Function Components. This decision is based on [React recommendations](https://react.dev/reference/react/Component).

The task is to update the component to be a functional component, without any difference in functionality. Also, all related tests that fail may need refactoring.

Here are a few examples of the required changes:
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24187
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24210
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24183
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/pull/24181

If the tests do not work because they rely on the behavior of Class Components they also have to be migrated to functionaly test the same behavior. We prefer the use of `react-testing-library` for new tests, but it is not required.

When submitting the PR, please make sure to identify where and when the component shows, for QA to properly test the changes.


----

If you're interested please comment here and come [join our "Contributors" community channel](https://community.mattermost.com/core/channels/tickets) on our daily build server, where you can discuss questions with community members and the Mattermost core team. For technical advice or questions, please  [join our "Developers" community channel](https://community.mattermost.com/core/channels/developers).

New contributors please see our [Developer's Guide](https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/).

JIRA LINK: MM-54814

comment.body: @KuSh We would appreciate if you do it. Sure, the component is deprecated, but still used in the code. Eventually we want to get rid of it, but we don't know when that will be. So... in the meantime, it is at least state of the art :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:

issue.body:
#### Summary
Closes #24959 
Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-52976

These changes should locally target our tooltip's context on announcement bar, Just as we'd like to address over this issue

```release-note
This widens the tooltip on announcement bar of the admin console
```

comment.body: @M-ZubairAhmed How do we get a test server running here?

This test seems to be testing that there is no error, but it doesn't seem to be testing the value is properly assigned. Are we trusting the implementation underneath, or do we want to add that to this test?

pull_request.title: [MM-55014][MM-55015] Add last login timestamp for users, add materialized view and refresh job to keep track of post stats for Postgres
pull_request.body:
#### Summary
This PR is the beginning of the work to support reporting on Users for administrators.

In this PR, we add the new `poststats` view for PostgreSQL that will be refreshed daily by a job that can be configured by the system administrator. In the view, we keep track of the user's posts per day and the last post that a user has made that day.

This will allow us to create queries that make for easy lookup of a users total posts and last post for a given date range.

Additional comments will be made on the code.

#### Ticket Link
https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-55014
https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-55015

#### Screenshots
![Screenshot 2023-10-25 at 3 33 37 PM](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/assets/52460000/e9429c7c-7c89-419a-aabc-9a15b6a397cd)

#### Release Note
```release-note
Add last login timestamp for users, add materialized view and refresh job to keep track of post stats for Postgres
```

 	TermsOfServiceCreateAt int64     `json:"terms_of_service_create_at,omitempty"`

+	LastLogin              int64     `json:"last_login,omitempty"`
comment.body: I don't see anything sanitizing this value, so I guess it is sent with any other request that fetch a user. Am I right? If so, is it something we want to broadcast that way?

pull_request.title: Fix Webpack warnings
pull_request.body:
#### Summary
These warnings have been printed by Webpack for ages, but they get really annoying if using `make dev`

That CSS has never done anything since it's always been invalid, and since we're not actively using module federation, I don't think we need to fix the version of prop-types. By the time we actually get back to module federation, we'll hopefully all be on TypeScript so we won't need that library anyway

#### Release Note
```release-note
NONE
```

issue.title: Cut off text in the Position field in the profile modal
issue.body: Hi! In version ММ 8 we noticed that in the profile modal window when clicking on a username in the channel window the Position field is not displayed in full. When editing a Profile, all the text is saved in full, but the text is cut off when shown in the channel window. Example on the attached image. Client MM version - 5.5.1 (mac & win) Server MM version - 8.1.2 #### Summary Unable to read the title of the Employee Position in its entirety #### Steps to reproduce - Open any channel - Click on the employee's name in the channel - Wait for the profile modal window to appear - View the Position field - The text in the Position field is cut off #### Expected behavior - Open any channel - Click on the employee's name in the channel - Wait for the profile modal window to appear - View the Position field - The text in the Position field is not cut off, but is transferred line by line. #### Observed behavior (that appears unintentional)

issue.title: MM-54976 Fix bug where newly created GMs show as having 0 members

labels.name: 4: Reviews Complete
labels.description: All reviewers have approved the pull request

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for contributing a pull request! Here are a few tips to help you:

1. If this is your first contribution, make sure you've read the Contribution Checklist https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/contribution-checklist/
2. Read our blog post about "Submitting Great PRs" https://developers.mattermost.com/blog/2019-01-24-submitting-great-prs
3. Take a look at other repository specific documentation at https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute
-->

#### Summary
Websocket events for updating a preference or list of preferences will load GM's upon new GM open.
Previously loading DM and GM was done when opening only a DM.
Now the logic is separated to load DM for DM event and GM for GM event.

QA test:
1. open 2 instances of the same user. (web + desktop)
2. create a new group message in 1 session
3. verify that the number members in the GM is correct for both sessions.
<!--
A description of what this pull request does, as well as QA test steps (if applicable and if not already added to the Jira ticket).
-->

#### Ticket Link
Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/25067
Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54976
<!--

* Bug fixes and fixes of previous known issues.
* Deprecation warnings, breaking changes, or compatibility notes.

If no release notes are required, write NONE. Use past-tense. Newlines are stripped.

Examples:

```
Added new API endpoints POST /api/v4/foo, GET api/v4/foo, and GET api/v4/foo/:foo_id.
```

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for contributing a pull request! Here are a few tips to help you:

1. If this is your first contribution, make sure you've read the Contribution Checklist https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/contribution-checklist/
2. Read our blog post about "Submitting Great PRs" https://developers.mattermost.com/blog/2019-01-24-submitting-great-prs
3. Take a look at other repository specific documentation at https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute
-->

#### Summary
Websocket events for updating a preference or list of preferences will load GM's upon new GM open.
Previously loading DM and GM was done when opening only a DM.
Now the logic is separated to load DM for DM event and GM for GM event.

QA test:
1. open 2 instances of the same user. (web + desktop)
2. create a new group message in 1 session
3. verify that the number members in the GM is correct for both sessions.
<!--
A description of what this pull request does, as well as QA test steps (if applicable and if not already added to the Jira ticket).
-->

#### Ticket Link
Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/25067
Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54976
<!--
If applicable, please include both or either of the following links:

Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/XXX
Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-XXX
-->

#### Screenshots
<!--
If the PR includes UI changes, include screenshots/GIFs.

For an easier comparison of UI changes a table (template below) can be used.

|  before  |  after  |
|----|----|
| <insert before screenshot here> | <insert after screenshot here> |

-->

#### Release Note
<!--
Add a release note for each of the following conditions:

* Config changes (additions, deletions, updates).
* API additions—new endpoint, new response fields, or newly accepted request parameters.
* Database changes (any).
* Schema migration changes. Use the [Schema Migration Template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18lD7N32oyMtYjFrJKwsNv8yn6Fe5QtF-eMm8nn0O8tk/edit?usp=sharing) as a starting point to capture these details as release notes. 
* Websocket additions or changes.
* Anything noteworthy to a Mattermost instance administrator (err on the side of over-communicating).
* New features and improvements, including behavioral changes, UI changes, and CLI changes.
* Bug fixes and fixes of previous known issues.
* Deprecation warnings, breaking changes, or compatibility notes.

If no release notes are required, write NONE. Use past-tense. Newlines are stripped.

Examples:

```
Added new API endpoints POST /api/v4/foo, GET api/v4/foo, and GET api/v4/foo/:foo_id.
```

```
Added a new config setting ServiceSettings.FooBar. Added a new column Foo to the Users table.
```

```
NONE
```
-->
```release-note
Fixed bug where newly created GMs show as having 0 members
```

commits.message:
getChannelAndMyMember to load profiles for new channel (#25127)

ws preferences change event load profiles for GM on GM show

getChannelAndMyMember user Promise.all

remove changes in getChannelAndMyMember

seperate perfence changes by DM and GM instead of load both

issue.title: Number in group at 0 with two open instances

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Community help wanted

issue.body:
#### Summary

If I create a group with two open instances(desktop & browser) with the same account, one of them stay to 0(in the group count)

#### Screenshot

![https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39456891/275570763-4a0daefa-d941-4743-9828-decad369f092.png](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39456891/275570763-4a0daefa-d941-4743-9828-decad369f092.png)

#### Steps to reproduce

1 - Open 2 instances (desktop & browser) with the same account.
2 - In the browser, create a group with few people.

#### Expected behavior

Get the correct count members on both.

#### Observed behavior (that appears unintentional)

Desktop count should be correct in the desktop app.

#### Possible fixes

This is likely happening because we don’t load the members of newly created GM channels when they’re received over the websocket.

To solve this, we want to load those when that happens.


----
If you're interested please comment here and come [join our "Contributors" community channel](https://community.mattermost.com/core/channels/tickets) on our daily build server, where you can discuss questions with community members and the Mattermost core team. For technical advice or questions, please  [join our "Developers" community channel](https://community.mattermost.com/core/channels/developers).

New contributors please see our [Developer's Guide](https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/).

JIRA: https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54976

pull_request.title: MM-55113: Replace usage of LocalizedIcon in 'user_settings_security.tsx' with i/span tags
pull_request.body:
<!-- Thank you for contributing a pull request! Here are a few tips to help you:

1. If this is your first contribution, make sure you've read the Contribution Checklist https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/contribution-checklist/
2. Read our blog post about "Submitting Great PRs" https://developers.mattermost.com/blog/2019-01-24-submitting-great-prs
3. Take a look at other repository specific documentation at https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute
-->

#### Summary
<!--
A description of what this pull request does, as well as QA test steps (if applicable and if not already added to the Jira ticket).
-->
Replace usage of LocalizedIcon in 'user_settings_security.tsx' with i/span tags

I've followed instructions but the component is already using Utils.formatMessage in other places. I was wondering if those could also be converted or if it would be wise to also use Utils.formatMessage for icons

#### Ticket Link
<!--
If applicable, please include both or either of the following links:

Jira https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-55113

If no release notes are required, write NONE. Use past-tense. Newlines are stripped.

Examples:

```
Added new API endpoints POST /api/v4/foo, GET api/v4/foo, and GET api/v4/foo/:foo_id.
```

```
Added a new config setting ServiceSettings.FooBar. Added a new column Foo to the Users table.
```
